name: 文法與修辭
description: This course will give an overview of the major features of English grammar. It will not cover all grammatical features in English, but rather aim at initiating independent thinking and research on the problematic areas of English grammar. You will become familiar with the intricacies of English grammar, particularly those that tend to be challenging to nonnative speakers. In this course you will learn to describe how English sentences are constructed and you will develop the skills necessary to analyze and explain English words, phrases and sentences, as well as learn the terminology to talk about them. In addition, you will learn about a corpus-based approach to studying vocabulary. Examining the use of words in natural contexts and different registers sheds light on our understanding of their true senses
goals: understand how English grammar works and feel more confident about helping your peers and/or ESL students use English accurately, meaningfully, and appropriately
identify and correct grammatical errors in spoken and written English and provide grammar explanations with commonly used terminology
explain how a word is used appropriately and how related words are distinguished
syllabus:
教學目標

This course will give an overview of the major features of English grammar. It will **not** cover **all** grammatical features in English, but rather aim at initiating independent thinking and research on the **problematic** areas of English grammar. You will become familiar with the intricacies of English grammar, particularly those that tend to be challenging to nonnative speakers. In this course you will learn to describe how English sentences are constructed and you will develop the skills necessary to analyze and explain English words, phrases and sentences, as well as learn the terminology to talk about them. You will also learn about rhetorical patterns in writing and how to apply the grammatical patterns to writing for the purpose of clarity and effectiveness.

教材大綱（含每週教學主題）

Week 1 Orientation

Week 2-4  Tense/aspect

Week 5-6  Passives

Week 7-8  Modal auxiliaries

Week 9 Mid-term

Week 10-11  Rhetorical skills

Week 12-13 Conditional clauses

Week 14 Restrictive & non-restrictive relative clauses

Week 15  Relative adverb clauses

Week 16-17  Adverbial clauses & reduced adverbials 

Week 18  Final exam
